intro: Aldama quinqueremis, commonly known as the five-ribbed aldama, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture.
